titleStmt.title: Shrowsbury for me: being a song in praise of that famous town, vvhich hath throughout all England gain'd renown. In praise thereof, let every one agree, and say with one accord, Shrowsbury for me. To a delightful new tune: or Shrowsbury for me.

Shrowsbury for me: being a song in praise of that famous town, vvhich hath throughout all England gain'd renown. In praise thereof, let every one agree, and say with one accord, Shrowsbury for me. To a delightful new tune: or Shrowsbury for me.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Wright, J. Clarke, W. Thackeray and T. Passenger,

notesStmt.note: Place and date range of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
First line: Come listen you gallants.
Second two columns headed: The second part, to the same tune.
Printed mostly in black letter in four columns.
Reproduction of original in: National Library of Scotland--Crawford Collections.
